channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Unions challenge WorkSafe on Covid-19 infections at Waitākere Hospital
item.description: Health unions are furious at WorkSafe's decision not to investigate how seven nurses caught Covid-19 at Waitākere Hospital.

item.title: Offshore wind farm proponents warned surf breaks will be protected
item.description: Proponents of an idea to build massive offshore wind farms off the coast of Taranaki are being warned its surf breaks will soon be protected and cannot be disturbed.

item.title: Lost pair spent nearly two weeks without food in Kahurangi National Park
item.description: The two trampers who went missing in bush north-west of Nelson say they spent nearly two weeks without food and their only saving grace was water they had found.

item.title: Live: Covid-19 updates from New Zealand and around the world on 28 May
item.description: The chair of the Trans-Tasman Safe Border Group is confident safe processes for travel could be put in place relatively quickly once flights get the go-ahead.

item.title: Advertising Standards Authority to fast-track takedown of misleading Covid-19 ads
item.description: At least seven companies have been forced to change or take down advertisements referencing Covid-19 following complaints to the Advertising Standards Authority.

item.title: Covid-19: House buyers now in financial strife risk losing deposits
item.description: Property developers and sellers are being urged to find a fair solution if a buyer suddenly finds themselves in financial hardship because of Covid-19.

item.title: 'Animal behaviour' in ferry queue sparks police complaints
item.description: Waiheke Island residents fed up with a lack of social distancing on ferries and at the wharves have complained to the police and local politicians.

item.title: Covid-19: Huge shortfall in public health investment, College of Public Health says
item.description: The number of doctors in public health units confronting the pandemic is in crisis, but there is no sign of a plan to fix this.

item.title: Prison population: Those awaiting trial expected to outnumber sentenced offenders by 2029
item.description: A Ministry of Justice report is forecasting the prison population to grow and for those awaiting trial to outnumber those already sentenced.

item.title: Queenstown welfare hub to open next week
item.description: Queenstown support services say they need a welfare hub more than ever as job losses continue to pile up.

item.title: Covid-19: What happened in NZ and around the world on 27 May
item.description: For the fifth day in a row, there are no new cases of Covid-19, the Prime Minister says it will not be too long before trans-Tasman travel is able to resume, GPs push for balance between face-to-face and online consultations and Australia recorded its ...

item.title: Missing trampers Dion Reynolds and Jessica O'Connor found alive, police confirm
item.description: Missing trampers Dion Reynolds and Jessica O'Connor stayed put and waited for help after suffering minor injuries in a fall, police have confirmed.

item.title: 'Milestone' pay settlement reached for teacher aides
item.description: The Ministry of Education and NZEI Te Riu Roa have agreed to settle an historic pay equity claim for teacher aides.

item.title: English language-only sign at cafe taken down
item.description: A sign in an Auckland cafe asking staff members to speak only English has been removed after it sparked debate when posted on social media.

item.title: Christchurch couple back in court despite winning Southern Response battle
item.description: A long-running legal battle between a Christchurch couple and Southern Response looks set to drag on.

item.title: 'Won't be too long' before trans-Tasman travel starts - PM
item.description: A group of government and business representatives will deliver a blueprint on how a trans-Tasman bubble could work early next month.

item.title: Uni may move hall residents to accommodate international students
item.description: The University of Auckland is considering moving domestic students out of halls of residence to make way for returning international students that need to be quarantined.

item.title: Academics say winter flu 'outbreaks' looming
item.description: It's hoped New Zealand efforts to flatten the Covid-19 curve will translate into a milder flu season this winter.
